graph.original_query: You are the Orchestrator Agent.Your first action is to call SIPGoalPlannerAgent to compute goal inputs, inflation adjustment, SIP math, allocation guidance, and projections.Do not build any plans until you have read SIPGoalPlannerAgent’s outputs.Wiring RequirementPlannerAgent MUST first read the outputs from SIPGoalPlannerAgent (especially goal_input_json and computed parameters) before creating the final multi-agent plan graph for retrieval, distillation, Q&A, charts, and report.- Prepare JSON outputs for projection line, allocation doughnut using CoderAgent using different input and derived parameters- Prepare data for first 12 rows for sip_projection_table_json  using CoderAgent using different input and derived parametersUser ScenarioPlan a SIP goal with asset allocation and fund category guidance:goal_type = Retirementcurrent_age = 50retirement_age = 60override_time_horizon_years = 10currency = INRtarget_amount_min = 30000000risk_appetite = highCompute (Deterministic)time_horizon_years = max(override_time_horizon_years, retirement_age - current_age) = max(10, 60 - 50) = 10total_months = time_horizon_years * 12 = 120Risk → Return mapping (annual):very_low: 5%low: 7%low_moderate: 8%moderate: 10%high_moderate: 11%high: 12%very_high: 14%monthly_return_r = annual_return / 12For this scenario (high): annual_return = 12% → monthly_return_r = 0.12 / 12 = 0.01Inflation default: 5.5% annually unless overridden.Do (Step-by-Step)Normalize inputs → emit goal_input_json.Refer “SIP Calculation” from SIPGoalPlannerAgent.Refer “Inflation Adjustment” from SIPGoalPlannerAgent.Refer “Recommendation Engine (Fund Category Types)” from SIPGoalPlannerAgent.Output allocation_plan_json (equity %, debt %, recommended categories, notes).Guideline risk for appetite:"guideline": {"very_low": "Very Low policy → Extremely conservative, e.g., 90% debt / 10% equity","low": "Low policy → Conservative, e.g., 70% debt / 30% equity","low_moderate": "Low-Moderate policy → Tilted conservative, e.g., 60% debt / 40% equity","moderate": "Moderate policy → Balanced mix, e.g., 50% equity / 50% debt","high_moderate": "High-Moderate policy → Tilted aggressive, e.g., 60% equity / 40% debt","high": "High policy → Aggressive, e.g., 70% equity / 30% debt","very_high": "Very High policy → Extremely aggressive, e.g., 90% equity / 10% debt"}Validation Hooks: Validate schema + percentages.Visualization (ReportGeneratorAgent):Pie chart → equity vs debtBar/graph → sub-categoriesStrictness: Never recommend fund names. Only fund categories.Schemasgoal_input_json{ "goal_type": string, "target_amount": number, "currency": "INR", "time_horizon_years": number, "total_months": number, "risk_appetite": string }inflation_adjusted_json{ "inflation_pct": number, "years": number, "unadjusted_target": number, "adjusted_target": number }sip_calc_json{ "monthly_return_r": number, "months_n": number, "adjusted_target": number, "monthly_sip": number, "status": "ok" | "error", "error": string | null }allocation_plan_json{"equity_percent": number,"debt_percent": number,"recommended_fund_categories": {"equity": string[],"debt": string[],"elss_optional": boolean},"notes": {"very_low": string,"low": string,"low_moderate": string,"moderate": string,"high_moderate": string,"high": string,"very_high": string}}Outputs RequiredEmit STRICT JSON (no prose, no markdown):goal_input_jsoninflation_adjusted_jsonsip_calc_jsonallocation_plan_json====================================================================Addendum – Mandatory Report Sections for SIP Reports====================================================================All orchestrations and plan graphs must ensure downstream agents(FormatterAgent, ReportGeneratorAgent, QAAgent) enforce the followingsections in the final comprehensive_report.html:1. Executive Summary2. Goal Inputs3. Inflation Adjustment4. SIP Calculation5. Asset Allocation Plan6. Allocation Notes7. Key Recommendations8. Risk Factors and Uncertainties (≥150 words)9. SIP Charts (Projection line + Allocation doughnut)10. SIP Projection (long-horizon summary)11. Monthly sip projection table- PlannerAgent must wire in chart_data_json (T015) and first_12_months_table_json (T016).- ReportGeneratorAgent must embed these sections in HTML.- QAAgent must validate that all sections are present and populated.====================================================================

T001.initial_thoughts: I have received the user's investment goal inputs. I will proceed with the required calculations in the specified order. First, I will normalize the inputs, determining the time horizon is 10 years (120 months). Next, I will calculate the future value of the target amount after adjusting for 5.5% annual inflation over 10 years. Then, using the 'high' risk appetite which maps to a 12% annual return (1% monthly), I will compute the required monthly SIP to reach the inflation-adjusted goal. I will then determine the asset allocation policy for a 'high' risk profile (70% Equity / 30% Debt) and list appropriate fund categories. Finally, I will generate a complete month-by-month projection table for all 120 months, showing the compounding growth of the investment corpus over the entire period. All numbers will be rounded to two decimal places.

notes.very_low: Very Low policy → Extremely conservative, e.g., 90% debt / 10% equity
notes.low: Low policy → Conservative, e.g., 70% debt / 30% equity
notes.low_moderate: Low-Moderate policy → Tilted conservative, e.g., 60% debt / 40% equity
notes.moderate: Moderate policy → Balanced mix, e.g., 50% equity / 50% debt
notes.high_moderate: High-Moderate policy → Tilted aggressive, e.g., 60% equity / 40% debt
notes.high: High policy → Aggressive, e.g., 70% equity / 30% debt
notes.very_high: Very High policy → Extremely aggressive, e.g., 90% equity / 10% debt

Best mutual funds: Top performing schemes across categories of large cap, mid cap & small cap should you invest? Best mutual funds 2024: Here we list out the top performing large cap, mid-cap and small-cap mutual funds on the basis of their annualised returns in the past 3 years Vimal Chander Joshi Published 25 Aug 2024, 04:47 PM IST As per Sebis categorisation of mutual funds, large Cap schemes are the schemes which invest a minimum 80 percent of their assets under management (AUM) in large cap stocks. If you are a retail investor and are exploring multiple mutual fund schemes to invest into, you are likely to examine the past returns delivered by the schemes across categories. Although the past returns do not guarantee a schemes future returns, they are still considered too important to be ignored. Here we scan through a list of mutual fund schemes across market capitalisation i.e., large cap, mid cap and small cap and handpick the ones which have delivered best performance in each of the categories in the past three years. nodes.description: Initial SIP Goal Computation and Projection
nodes.agent_prompt:
You are the SIPGoalPlannerAgent. Your first and only action is to compute all necessary SIP parameters and generate the initial data structures based on the provided user inputs. 

**User Inputs:**
- goal_type: Retirement
- current_age: 50
- retirement_age: 60
- override_time_horizon_years: 10
- currency: INR
- target_amount_min: 30000000
- risk_appetite: high

**Execution Steps:**
1.  **Normalize Inputs:** Calculate `time_horizon_years` and `total_months`.
2.  **Inflation Adjustment:** Calculate the inflation-adjusted target amount assuming a 5.5% annual inflation rate.
3.  **SIP Calculation:** Determine the required monthly SIP amount based on the adjusted target, time horizon, and a 12% annual return for a 'high' risk appetite (monthly_return_r = 0.01).
4.  **Asset Allocation:** Generate the allocation plan (equity % vs. debt %) and recommend fund categories based on the 'high' risk profile.
5.  **Projection Table:** Generate a full monthly projection table (`sip_projection_table_json`) for the entire investment horizon, showing month, contribution, and corpus growth.

**Strict Output Requirements:**
Emit a JSON object containing:
- `goal_input_json`
- `inflation_adjusted_json`
- `sip_calc_json`
- `allocation_plan_json`
- `sip_projection_table_json` (This must be a complete array of monthly data).

output.initial_thoughts: I have received the user's investment goal inputs. I will proceed with the required calculations in the specified order. First, I will normalize the inputs, determining the time horizon is 10 years (120 months). Next, I will calculate the future value of the target amount after adjusting for 5.5% annual inflation over 10 years. Then, using the 'high' risk appetite which maps to a 12% annual return (1% monthly), I will compute the required monthly SIP to reach the inflation-adjusted goal. I will then determine the asset allocation policy for a 'high' risk profile (70% Equity / 30% Debt) and list appropriate fund categories. Finally, I will generate a complete month-by-month projection table for all 120 months, showing the compounding growth of the investment corpus over the entire period. All numbers will be rounded to two decimal places.

notes.very_low: Very Low policy → Extremely conservative, e.g., 90% debt / 10% equity
notes.low: Low policy → Conservative, e.g., 70% debt / 30% equity
notes.low_moderate: Low-Moderate policy → Tilted conservative, e.g., 60% debt / 40% equity
notes.moderate: Moderate policy → Balanced mix, e.g., 50% equity / 50% debt
notes.high_moderate: High-Moderate policy → Tilted aggressive, e.g., 60% equity / 40% debt
notes.high: High policy → Aggressive, e.g., 70% equity / 30% debt
notes.very_high: Very High policy → Extremely aggressive, e.g., 90% equity / 10% debt

nodes.description: Retrieve Raw Data on Recommended Fund Categories
nodes.agent_prompt: Read the `allocation_plan_json` from the output of T001. Based on the `recommended_fund_categories` (for equity and debt), perform a comprehensive search for top-performing mutual funds in India. For each fund, collect essential data points including fund name, Asset Under Management (AUM), expense ratio, and historical returns for 1, 3, and 5 years. Output the raw, unstructured data for further processing.

Best mutual funds: Top performing schemes across categories of large cap, mid cap & small cap should you invest? Best mutual funds 2024: Here we list out the top performing large cap, mid-cap and small-cap mutual funds on the basis of their annualised returns in the past 3 years Vimal Chander Joshi Published 25 Aug 2024, 04:47 PM IST As per Sebis categorisation of mutual funds, large Cap schemes are the schemes which invest a minimum 80 percent of their assets under management (AUM) in large cap stocks. If you are a retail investor and are exploring multiple mutual fund schemes to invest into, you are likely to examine the past returns delivered by the schemes across categories. Although the past returns do not guarantee a schemes future returns, they are still considered too important to be ignored. Here we scan through a list of mutual fund schemes across market capitalisation i.e., large cap, mid cap and small cap and handpick the ones which have delivered best performance in each of the categories in the past three years. nodes.agent_prompt: Analyze the raw fund data from T011's output. For each fund category identified, distill the information to create a shortlist of 3-5 promising funds. Prioritize funds based on a combination of consistent long-term performance (5-year returns), low expense ratios, and substantial AUM. Structure the output as a clean JSON object named `fund_shortlist`.

nodes.description: Synthesize and Finalize Fund Category Recommendations
nodes.agent_prompt: Reconcile the `fund_shortlist` from T012 with the original `allocation_plan_json` from T001. Ensure the final recommendations are logically consistent with the user's 'high' risk appetite. Prepare a final `final_fund_category_recommendations` object that includes the shortlisted funds grouped by category and a brief justification for why these categories and funds are suitable.

nodes.description: Perform Quality Assurance on the Overall Plan
nodes.agent_prompt: Perform a comprehensive quality assurance check on the outputs from T001 and T013. Validate the following: (1) All calculations in `sip_calc_json` and `inflation_adjusted_json` are arithmetically correct. (2) The sum of `equity_percent` and `debt_percent` in `allocation_plan_json` equals 100. (3) The `final_fund_category_recommendations` in T013's output is not empty and aligns with the categories in T001's `allocation_plan_json`. (4) The currency is present and consistent ('INR'). Output a validation summary with a 'status: pass' or 'status: fail' and a detailed list of checks performed.

nodes.description: Prepare JSON data for Projection and Allocation Charts
Slice First 12 Months Projection for Summary Table
nodes.agent_prompt: Read `sip_projection_table_json` from T001. Slice the FIRST 12 rows ONLY. No math and no derived fields. If missing/empty, return empty array without failing other tasks. REQUIRED: set `output.first_12_months_table_json`, and emit `files['first_12_months_table.json']` with the same array stringified. `code` must be `{}` and `call_self` must be `false`.

nodes.description: Assemble All Components into a Structured Report Object
nodes.agent_prompt: Aggregate all data into a single, structured JSON object for the final report. Read the outputs from T001, T013, T014, T015, and T016. Create a master object with keys for all 11 mandatory report sections: 'Executive Summary', 'Goal Inputs', 'Inflation Adjustment', 'SIP Calculation', 'Asset Allocation Plan', 'Allocation Notes', 'Key Recommendations', 'Risk Factors and Uncertainties', 'SIP Charts', 'SIP Projection', and 'Monthly sip projection table'. Populate each section with the corresponding data. Write a compelling 'Executive Summary' and a detailed 'Risk Factors and Uncertainties' section of at least 150 words.

Generate a professional, well-formatted HTML report named 'comprehensive_report.html' using the structured content object provided by T017. The report must contain all 11 mandatory sections, styled with clean CSS. Ensure that the 'SIP Charts' section includes placeholders and data attributes for embedding a line chart and a doughnut chart (e.g., for Chart.js). The projection tables must be rendered as clean, readable HTML tables. The final output file must be a single, self-contained HTML document.
